meanings.definition: The youngest or smallest in a group of babies.
meanings.sent1: The babiest kitten in the litter was so tiny and cute.
meanings.sent2: The babiest member of the family always gets a lot of attention.
meanings.sent3: The babiest duckling kept tripping over its own feet, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as soft and delicate as the babiest whisper.
meanings.sent5: The babiest puppy had the most adorable little yawn.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of the adjective 'baby', meaning the most baby-like or infantile.
meanings.sent1: The babiest blanket was the softest and fluffiest one in the nursery.
meanings.sent2: She had the babiest face with chubby cheeks and big, innocent eyes.
meanings.sent3: His babiest behavior included sucking his thumb and carrying a teddy bear everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The babiest clouds floated lazily in the sky, resembling cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The babiest giggles filled the room, bringing joy to everyone present.

meanings.definition: The act of behaving in a babyish or immature manner.
meanings.sent1: Her constant whining was a clear display of her babiest tendencies.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't stand her babiest antics during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The babiest of his excuses for being late was blaming it on a lost sock.
meanings.sent4: Their babiest behavior at the party involved throwing food at each other.
meanings.sent5: The babiest tantrum she threw involved stomping her feet and pouting.
